snippet: The Government Communications Headquarters had been accused of accessing information from an American surveillance program.
abstract: Parliamentary committee clears Britain's electronic intelligence-gathering agency of working with its American counterparts to bypass laws governing collection of data about its citizens, but says new legislation might be needed to police electronic surveillance.
lead_paragraph: The Government Communications Headquarters had been accused of accessing information from an American surveillance program.

headline.main: British Agency Is Cleared of Illegal Data Gathering
headline.print_headline: British Agency Is Cleared of Illegal Data Gathering
